intro: Chavica hainana, commonly known as the Chinese bellflower, is a flowering plant native to East Asia. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its bell-shaped, blue or purple flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments and has lance-shaped leaves. It is often cultivated for its ornamental value due to its attractive blooms. The flowers bloom in summer and are pollinated primarily by insects.
